title.narrative: Power Up West Africa

description.narrative: The PowerUp! consortium was established to engage Women Human Rights Defenders (WHRDs) and their organizations and networks, particularly LBQ women, women living with HIV+, sex workers, women workers, and indigienous women. The goal of the project is to build, organise, mobilise, and transform power based on three themes; bodies, resources, and voice.

mailing-address.narrative: 35 Menton Road, Richmond, Johannesburg, South Africa, 2093

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

title.narrative: 5.3. Increased feminist solidarity and urgent action responses
5.3.1 # solidarity/urgent actions supported by PU!

comment.narrative: As the indicator measures any new values occurring since the start of the intervention, the baseline value is set at 0. Specific details regarding the situation at the start can be found in the narrative baseline report.
Target is annual, will increase each period

16 Days of Activism - Violence against women and gender-based violence (GBV) remain an international pandemic. 2021, marked the 30th anniversary of the 16 days of activism campaign which is held annually from the 25th of November to the 10th of December. The campaign focused on locating the systems in which oppression against women continues to thrive in order to find grass-root, sustainable solutions in partnership with the communities we work with.

Feminist Disruptor's handbook was was created. Under #16Daysof Activism campaign: 3 online workshops were, a twitter space, Instgram live and a webinar.

Partnership Building workshops - we engaged with local/community based organisations to identify their knowledge and capacity re: national/regional/international human rights mechanisms. To create spaces that generate and strengthen ideas and knowledge in relation to power, freedom, dignity and justice.

title.narrative: 4.1 Increased leadership capacity and organising skills of women to bring about change in their lives and communities
4.1.1b # women (non-youth) who report increased confidence, political skills and consciousness as a result of PU! interventions

comment.narrative: As the indicator measures any new values occurring since the start of the intervention, the baseline value is set at 0. Specific details regarding the situation at the start can be found in the narrative baseline report.
Target is annual, will increase each period

Partnership building workshops - 1. resulted in the development of a stronger feminist network. The need for cross regional conversations on feminism was highlighted. How consistent feminist organising provides a safe space for young LGBT womxn/Feminists. The activity partially met it's objective because the subgrants have not yet been disbursed. Once disbursed implementation will start.

title.narrative: 6.1. Increased actions of women using their collective power to demand rights, increase access to resources and ensure collective safety

The CoVID-19 pandemic further exposed the injustices faced by the LGBT communities and their vunerabilities. Due to lockdowns it made organising difficult for members of these communities. PU supported to this process during the National conversations where new partners attend and from that organising it came to light that there is a need for cross-regional conversations around power, voice and resources.

title.narrative: 1.1 Women make decisions about their bodies, violence is reduced and safety is improved
1.1. BODIES: # of laws, policies and strategies blocked, adopted or improved to eradicate all forms of violence against women in public and private life.

comment.narrative: As the indicator measures any new values occurring since the start of the intervention, the baseline value is set at 0. Specific details regarding the situation at the start can be found in the narrative baseline report.

At the midline, it is expected that 50% of all country targets of this indicator have been reached. For IATI, this indicator will show the 5 year target both for midline and endline as it cannot be predicted in advance which ones will be completed.

title.narrative: 2.1 Women express their views and participate in all decision-making

2.1. VOICES: # of laws, policies and strategies blocked, adopted or improved to promote women’s voice, agency, leadership and solutions, and representative participation in decision-making processes in public, private and civic sphere.

comment.narrative: As the indicator measures any new values occurring since the start of the intervention, the baseline value is set at 0. Specific details regarding the situation at the start can be found in the narrative baseline report.

At the midline, it is expected that 50% of all country targets of this indicator have been reached. For IATI, this indicator will show the 5 year target both for midline and endline as it cannot be predicted in advance which ones will be completed.

title.narrative: 3.1 Women have access to resources and economic autonomy

title.narrative: 3.2 Women have access to resources and economic autonomy

3.2. RESOURCES: # of times that WROs (disaggregated by women-led, youth-led or other and formal/informal) succeed in creating space for feminist demands and positions on women’s economic rights, economic justice and alternatives, through agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or movement building.

comment.narrative: As the indicator measures any new values occurring since the start of the intervention, the baseline value is set at 0. Specific details regarding the situation at the start can be found in the narrative baseline report.
The midline target is set at 50% of the endline target.
